contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} <!--SCROLL DOWN IN ORDER TO EDIT THE ARTICLE--> {{Infobox PolishCoA| herb=Kot morski| image=POL COA Kot Morski.svg| battlecry=-| alternative=Cattus Marinus| mention=1413| families=Korzun, Kot, Kotłubaj, Swarożyński, Wilkolewicz, Wiłkolowicz, Wirkolowicz, Wojsnar, Wojsznar, Wojszwiłło, Woysznar, Woysznarowicz| towns=none| }} '''Kot morski''' ([[Polish language|Polish]] for "Sea Cat") is a [[Polish heraldry|Polish coat of arms]]. It was used by several ''[[szlachta]]'' (noble) families under the [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]]. ==History== <!--Here goes the history and the legend of the Coat of Arms--> {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Blazon== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Notable bearers== Notable bearers of this [[coat of arms]] have included: * ==See also== * [[Polish heraldry]] * [[Heraldry]] * [[Coat of arms]] {{Coats of arms of Polish families}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kot Morski Coat Of Arms}} [[Category:Polish coats of arms|Kot morski]] {{poland-heraldry-stub}} {{Link GA|pl}}
